Module geci.api
Package javax0.geci.api

Interface Geci

    • Method Detail

      • source

        Geci source​(java.lang.String... directory)
        Add a new directory to the list of source directories that Geci should process.
        Parameters:
        directory - list of directories that can be used as alternatives. When looking for files the first is used at start, if that fails then the second and so on.
        Returns:
        this

      • source

        Geci source​(Source.Set set,
            java.lang.String... directory)
        Add a new directory to the list of source directories that Geci should process. The set of source files will belong to the set represented by the first argument and can later be referenced. This is needed when a generator wants to open a new source but in a different source set than where the source worked up is.
        Parameters:
        directory - list of directories that can be used as alternatives. When looking for files the first is used at start, if that fails then the second and so on.
        set - identifies the source set with a name
        Returns:
        this

      • source

        default Geci source​(Source.Maven maven)

      • register

        Geci register​(Generator... generatorArr)
        Register one or more generator instances. (Probably instances of different generators.)
        Parameters:
        generatorArr - the generators to register
        Returns:
        this

      • generate

        boolean generate()
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Run the code generation.
        Returns:
        false if the code generation did not produce any output. It means that the code was already up to date. true when code was generated. When the code generation is executed as a unit test this return value can be asserted and compilation may fail in case code was changed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - in case a generator could not finish its operation and throws exception
